summary: This is an email chain from February 24, 2020, between federal prosecutors and defense attorney Bruce Barket. Barket informs the prosecution that his trial schedule has changed and inquires about the need to adjourn an upcoming status conference for his client, Mr. Tartaglione, due to a 'Curcio issue' (a hearing about potential conflicts of interest in legal representation).

persons.name: Bruce Barket
persons.context: Attorney writing to federal prosecutors about scheduling a status conference for his client, Mr. Tartaglione, and mentioning a Curcio issue.

persons.name: Bobbi
persons.context: Mentioned by a prosecutor as someone they need to talk to before getting back to the email's sender.

persons.name: Mr. Tartaglione
persons.context: Defendant represented by Bruce Barket; a status conference for him is being discussed.

persons.name: Judge Karas
persons.context: Mentioned as a potential judicial authority Bruce Barket might ask for help regarding the scheduling issue.

connections.description: Bruce Barket is the defense attorney representing Mr. Tartaglione, as indicated by his discussion of the status conference and Curcio issue.
Attorney Barket mentions potentially asking Judge Karas for help with a scheduling matter.

events.title: Rescheduled Trial Start for Bruce Barket
events.description: Bruce Barket's trial, which was originally supposed to begin on February 24, 2020, was moved to March 3, 2020.

events.title: Requested Date Off for Tartaglione Conference
events.description: Bruce Barket requested March 4th off from the court (EDNY) to attend a status conference for his client Mr. Tartaglione, citing a Curcio issue. The request was denied.

events.title: Email Correspondence Regarding Scheduling
events.description: Bruce Barket emails federal prosecutors to update them on his trial schedule and discuss the potential adjournment of Mr. Tartaglione's status conference.

locations: 666 Old Country Road, Ste. 700, Garden City, NY 11530
keyFacts: Defense attorney Bruce Barket was representing a defendant named Mr. Tartaglione in a case that involved a 'Curcio issue,' indicating a potential conflict of interest in legal representation.
Barket's law firm is 'Barket Epstein Kearon Aldea & LoTurco, LLP,' which includes 'Epstein' in its name, suggesting a professional connection to the broader Epstein case context.
A status conference for Mr. Tartaglione was imminent, and scheduling conflicts with Barket's other trial were causing complications.
The communication shows coordination (or attempted coordination) between a defense attorney and federal prosecutors regarding case scheduling and legal procedures.
